outputs.output_descr: The impact of disasters is on the raise mainly due to the fact that communities and their possessions are ever more exposed to the impact of natural hazards.  Unplanned urbanization, environmental degradation, population growth and poverty are some of the inter-linked factors that increase the vulnerability of a large number of communities in Cape Verde.  Small islands economy, infrastructure, and human costs are hugely impacted by disasters which hinders the prospect of the sustainable development. The main goal of this project is to strengthen national capacities for disaster risk reduction and management, by developing a National Risk Information system and  reinforcing institutional capacity to integrate disaster risk reduction into the development and sectoral planning at all levels.
Ce projet vise appuyer la realisation de la conference sur les SIDS (petits pays insulaires) qui auyra lieu à Mindelo, São Vicente , Cap Vert, du 24 au 27 juillet 2013.

project_descr: Capacity development for Disaster Risk Reduction and implementation of a Low-Emissions Climate Resilient Development Strategy
project_title: Governance for the sustainable reduction of risks
